Reviews.Title: “Funky Frugual Fun”
Reviews.Author: PeteyP617
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vibe Hotel under the recommendation of some friends and we had a blast! We were going to see a show at the Music Box and it was conveniently right down the street about a 5 minute walk. We came on a Wednesday night and there was free tacos and beer as well as a karaoke party. The people staying here were mostly travelers, because this place is also a hostel so lots of nice backpackers from all over the world. The room was large and clean with crazy retro artwork. There was a free breakfast, free wifi, and free laundry soap for washing clothes! This place is a great option for travelers or for someone who needs a cost effective option for a fun night in Hollywood!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to be back”
Reviews.Author: Kali712
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the banana bungalow in Hollywood for four nights. I was a little confused at first, because the place has two  names, it's also called Vibe. This was a little confusing, luckily the driver knew what that was all about, otherwise I may have had problem coming on my own. Banana bungalow is in a great place right on Hollywood.  You can see the Hollywood sign form the hostel if  stand  on  second floor. I  do the L.A. It was longer than posted on the board, but we do a lot of stops and had time to walk in Hollywood and have lunch in Venice(awesome). It was a great way to see things quickly. There was another  banana bungalow that was in the West Hollywood, which seemed very different, but it also  a really good area. Its close to this popular mall, I think it's called the farmers grove. Spent some time there while they were filming television show. Saw that guy from Saved by the Bell and just missed seeing a Kardasian.  Not sure which one. The rooms at  bungalow are very  good. There are 6 beds in my room and a large kitchen, so it feels like another room to hang out with a modern TV. There were many parties at night, it was a little loud but it was Saturday. I went with the group to  three different night clubs, wished I'd stayed at the first one, but it was good to see different things. I don't have any really bad things to say about Banana Bungalow. The staff was very helpful and know  everything to do in the city. I didn't go to the downtown, but everything else I did. The price was also very good, and there is a free breakfast, and you can buy more food for cheap if you like. I will love to come back again. Ciao Boogie.

Reviews.Title: “A decent inexpensive option”
Reviews.Author: CreepyRoss
Reviews.Content: I live in LA, but was going to a concert at the bowl and was looking for an inexpensive room for the night. The Vibe Hotel - it's really a motel - turned out to be a halfway decent choice. It's not in the greatest part of town, but the streets are all well lit, so my wife and I were comfortable walking to and from the motel even late at night. It's a little over a mile walk to hollywood and highland and mann's Chinese theater. The rate for a private room was $89 (+3 using a credit card). Any additional taxes/fees were included in the $89. The room itself was pretty small, but was reasonably clean. To my surprise, it included a microwave, fridge and, get this, a bunk bed. The room already had a queen size bed. Maybe this is why the room seemed so small. The bed was comfy enough. Contrary to some other reviews, the staff was very friendly. The Thai restaurant next door is supposed to be good. And there's a Tommy's Burger a block away! From what I saw, most of the other guests were young europeans. A cereal and toast breakfast is included. Additionally, the night we were there, there was a BBQ with free beer and a dj. We missed it because of our concert, so I can't comment. There were free Internet stations everywhere. I didn't have any issues with noise, but I'm a heavy sleeper. With the younger crowd and the Hollywood blvd location, I could see how noise could be a potential problem. If I ever need a cheap room in Hollywood, I'd come back to the Vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip but...”
Reviews.Author: jamjarhead
Reviews.Content: The Vibe is located within walking distance of Hollywood and Vine, the Walk of the Stars, The Kodak Theater, The Wax Museum, Ripley's Believe It or Not, Mann's Chinese Theatre, etc. The location is great (many restaurants and shops) and the room are funky and retro 70s. They are clean and some rooms have a kitchen for longer stays. It is more for the younger set. There are organized day trips and pizza parties with free beer. If you are looking for quiet stay away from hustle and bustle this is not the place. On weekends especially the air is charged with youthful exuberance. The price is right and overall I would highly recommend The Vibe for a HOLLYWOOD experience. Bring beach towels to hang over the windows. The curtains are very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: twinkfran
Reviews.Content: I love this hostel/hotel. It has a great location in Hollywood, is clean, spacious and along with its sister hostels always provides evening entertainment. We were there for Halloween and a free keg party! Staff are always friendly and it wasn't too noisy. Free breakfast is coffee and toast. Is expensive for a hostel but cheap for a central budget hotel and probably nicer. We took a private ensuite but the dorms looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Vibe”
Reviews.Author: rce9
Reviews.Content: We arrived to check in and were told it was an additional $3 to put the room on our credit card, or we could pay cash. We stayed in a private room, sloppily painted walls door was cracked at the bottom corner and the bed was uncomfortable. Internet was intermittant. We stayed Saturday night they had a band that played until 11 pm and we were awoken at 7:15 am on Sunday by roofers banging on the roof for about an hour and 1/2. I feel for the price we payed to stay here $110 we could have stayed in a nicer hotel. Lesson learned

Reviews.Title: “awful Vibe”
Reviews.Author: CanadaMochilera
Reviews.Content: The website makes it look great, the place is a dump. evidence of bedbugs, unfriendly staff and general bad feel. I do not have high expectations and don't agree with alot of the reviews found on trip advisor but ewww, stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: Turned away before we even got there!! Serious poor management”
Reviews.Author: Muertos
Reviews.Content: I read about the poor management reviews of the Vibe and decided to take my chances. The Vibe seriously screwed up my weekend - turned us away and forced us to search for a hotel in Hollywood at 10 o'clock at night. Seriously uncalled for. I had scheduled a room a week in advance at the Vibe, and even called in during the middle of the week to make sure they had me down for the room. We were running late the day of arrival so I gave them a call to let them know we'd be there, but then I was told that our room had been given away and we were moved to The Orbit (sister hotel of the Vibe) on the other side of Hollywood!! I specifically wanted the Vibe because it was within walking distance of a festival we were going to. We never received any phone call about the change and were told that they had no paper work for us. We straight up told them that this was bad management and insisted that we receive a free night for the mishap. Free night was out of the question and we were in fact turned away and told that we were not welcomed! We stayed at a miserable hotel on the first night (The Townehouse on Sunset), and then stayed at Magic Castle on Franklin Ave, which was wonderful and I really recommend them if you want a comfortable stay. It's more expensive obviously but to have the quality and assurance makes the trip so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation for a budget!”
Reviews.Author: joeljade
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here because friend's had recommended it :) It was great. We were on Hollywood Blvd, the bus stops right out front of the hostel & the hostel offers great tours. The tours were small groups & reasonably priced, we did the night tour & the LA tour which included Beverley Hills, Bel Air, Venice Beach etc. We enjoyed the free breakfast, free WIFI & the karaoke night which included dinner & free drinks. The staff were great & very helpful. We stayed in a private room with a kitchen, it was clean & spacious. We couldn't have asked for more on our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: miamelo
Reviews.Content: Well...we have been travelling for three years and have stayed in more places than I can remember. I can say that this place was not high on my list. Lets start with the staff. NOT IMPRESSED!! They were rude and extremely unhelpful, had no idea about where to go or what to do in LA. They live here for crying out loud and they didn't even know there was a huge red tourist bus that went to al the major sites. Also, with the planned activities what a joke. We had free dinner at the Vibe Bar, which they forgot to tell us that this 'Bar' was actually just their other hostel not even a proper bar. Then they had a free shuttle there, dropped us off without telling us anything about where we were going, then after asking I found out there was no shuttle back. Now onto location. Not really knowing anything about LA before getting here. West Hollywood is a good hour walk to Hollywood and over an hour to the beach. Wish I had know that when I was booking this hostel. My advice, stay in Hollywood, not West Hollywood!! If you are thinking of staying at the West Hollywood, don't stay somewhere else that is close to civilisation. Happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Not what the pictures shows”
Reviews.Author: reviewer1272
Reviews.Content: This was not what we had expected when we turned up. We were first greeted (rudely) by the woman on the desk who instructed us that we had to wait 4.5 hrs to check into our room at midday. Which would have been fine under normal circumstances, but she was talking about the room being used the day before for a photo shoot, and that the room was completely empty the night before, and still wouldnt let us in after a horrible 8 hour grehound trip. The room was awful. The lurid green paint job was sloppy and the furniture was broken. The bathroom was AWFUL. The toilet needed to be flushed over and over again just to flush a tissue. The shower was terrible, it ran cold constantly and the pressure was non-existant. on our 4th day the electricity in our room completely died, and no-one turned up to fix it until later on in the day. When we asked to print out our tour voucher on the office printer, i was told by the clueless woman behind the counter that "we dont have a printer", and there was one sitting directly behind her. The free breakfast was average, cereal and toast. There was no option for soy milk or any other breakfast alternative, unless you wanted to pay for it. We had no housekeeping for the whole ten days we stayed, so we emptied our own rubbish and had to return dirty towels for clean ones. The staff that worked there were not helpfull at all, and it seemed like they were working for accommodation. Particularly one australian woman was exceptionally rude to us. I would never, ever recommend this hotel to anyone. stay closer to the strip, because it is not as close as the Vibe suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag!”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal_18
Reviews.Content: We arrived off a long flight exhausted to drag our cases up some stairs to our private with bathroom accomodation. The shower was broken and the speakers on the windows (enticing people to come inside) were blasting loud music. So it wasn't a good start. The rooms were also very hot and the single fan didn't do much to improve this. We stayed there for a week and slowly got used to the place. The staff weren't very helpful with directions or information and there was cockroaches and bed bugs sharing the room with us! But there were some good things about the place. The location is great...walking distance to Hollywood (you can walk to many food places, shops, kodak theatre, Chinese Theatre, tour operators, JImmy Kimble show, Hollywood Museum, Wax Museum, a theatre showing the latest production 'Wicked' and the Ripleys Believe it or not museum). The motel also ran group trips to Venice Beach or Universal Studios. They had theme party nights and night club crawls. They offered free breakfast of toast, cereal and hot drinks. And for only $2 you could get pancakes, bacon and eggs. There was free internet (although the 10 min rule didn't seem to apply to some people and the computers crashed all the time). There was free movies on a big screen TV (not that you could hear them if a party was going on). There was snack and drink machines in the lobby and a nice view of palm trees. Parking for your rental car was free but difficult as the car park sometimes got very full and people had to park behind other cars. So it certainly was a mixed bag!

Reviews.Title: “reservation and breakfast problems, otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: RicWic
Reviews.Content: First, it's strange that the place has two names (Banana Bungalow-Hollywood and Vibe Hotel) -- I never did figure out what's going on with that. (Check out the reviews under both names!) I booked a "premium private room" (with a kitchen) for a week for our family of four. The BB-H website said $10 extra per person per night (above two), but the VH site (I learned later) said $12 (and that's the rate they initially applied). When we arrived they tried to charge $15 (on grounds that now it was summer -- but of course they knew what date we were booking for when we booked)! Fortunately I had printed out the rate-page so they backed down (reluctantly). At first I got an email confirmation for a premium private room at the BB-WEST Hollywood -- but BB-WH doesn't have premium private rooms (with kitchen)! Eventually they got that sorted out, after being quite rude and unsympathetic ("you must have booked on the wrong site", but I had the print-out to prove that I hadn't). Our flight out of LA got canceled and we were put on a flight a day earlier so, out of courtesy, I called (before we arrived in LA) to say that we would only need 6 nights, not 7. They could only find a reservation for 4 days, which was rather worrying! Finally (after we arrived, and they checked it out more thoroughly) it turned out that we had 7 nights booked TWICE (but broken up, not all in the same room). Of course we had booked ONE room for the week, and they had said nothing about having to change rooms (twice!) when we booked. (I was quite unhappy about that and, perhaps for that reason, they ended up not moving us after all.) The "free breakfast" (toast and cereal) was supposed to be served 8:00-11:00, but the first day they ran out of bread by 10:15, another day they were out of oatmeal, etc. Instead of making food available, one had to ask the girl behind the counter (for bread, or cereal, or milk for coffee) -- and a sign made it clear that she would like tips (for handing us our free breakfast?). I didn't like the arrangement. Otherwise we enjoyed the place. It's convenient to Hollywood (walking distance), convenient to the freeway, etc. And at least 3 of the 6 computers were usually working (best time to find them available: late at night).

Reviews.Title: “nice suprise, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: magtot
Reviews.Content: GREAT STAY HERE At the one end of Hollywood boulevard (other end prob best location, but then maybe not as safe at night?) Goes as Banana bungalows or VIBE Hotel. We stayed in a great private double which also had a bunk bed and ensuite with a kitchen too with dinning area. Free internet but can be very slow. This place was great really, extremely cheap. Washers/dryers only $1.25 per cycle. Free BBQ, TV/DVD room. BIG fan in room. We know people who stayed in other hostels on Hollywood blvd and said theres were dirty and ours wernt. I know we stayed in private room but in general the place was clean.

Reviews.Title: “very ok for the pric”
Reviews.Author: jurgenc
Reviews.Content: Our first days in the States we stayed at the vibe, it was noisy (our room was next to the street with a lot of traffic), but the room was big. The second day we had to move to another room, smaller but not so much noise. Rooms were colourfull but old. Location is good, walking distance to kodak theatre and stuff. We paid 55 bucks for a double room, so if you are on a budget and just need a place to leave your stuff and sleep, the vibe is 4 you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: meltrev
Reviews.Content: I was a traveller from Australia, and pretty much lived at the Vibe! Whenever I was in LA, it was the only place I stayed. It is a hostel for the most part, massive parties and loud noise - so I would recommend it for travellers. BBQ's, party room, pool table, and now I've heard there's a sunning area out the back - it's all your looking for if you're a young person in LA. There's a bus stop directly out front, loads of food places, close to the hollywood tourist attractions, and a couple of blocks from the metro. I was originally by myself until my best friends arrived and we always stayed back at the Vibe, whenever we were in LA. Staff were fun and tried to create greater social opportunities and events for everyone to hang out, especially in the lead up to summer. I will admit that when I very first showed up by myself, I was a little bit worried at what I had gotten myself into, but I got over that within a day. A lot of English and Aussie travellers stay here, and I made a lot of friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: frogster4
Reviews.Content: This place is truly horrible! The pretty pictures on the website do not tell the true story!!! This place is seriously run down! The staff do there best particularly the cleaning staff but what this place needs is a total refubishment!!! The owners and management should be ashamed of the way they promote this place and also the fact that they charge people at all!!! The place is dirty and depressing! We have stayed in loads of backpackers around the world and this has to be the worst we have seen. Please find somewhere nicer to stay on your visit to LA because this place is disgusting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all a 'Hotel' but ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: tourithst
Reviews.Content: The first thing here ( and this is a pretty general rule with booking accommodation online ) is not to be fooled by the website. The Vibe "Hotel" website benefits from some nice photography and some smart graphic design. In reality the style is spread a little thinner. I have to admit to being very nervous upon arriving at the Vibe, there wasn't really any signage and lets just say first impressions weren't great. Having said that, for the amount i was paying (cheaper than a hostel) i managed to get a room with a separate kitchen, double bed and cable tv - no complaints there. Everything was pretty clean in the room, outside wasn't so great and I suspect that the hotel actually owned a portion of the rooms in the complex as I'm sure half the residents were permanent! However... on the plus side: its on Hollywood Boulevard and close enough to Kodak etc. The parking is free and secure. It was very cheap. If you are looking for a place to hang out and relax then DON'T stay here - but its LA and who's got time to sit around - I used it as a place to crash at night and thats it. just a final note - i was traveling alone at the time - if I was travelling with someone and could split the cost of an actual 'hotel' room I would recommend getting something off wotif.com etc. instead

Reviews.Title: “Good deal-overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: olaaa
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the vibe for a week from dec 29-jan 05. booked a private room online. was worried about it after reading some bad reviews. i guess you could say we lucked out since we got what was advertised. it was a private room, clean (i was worried it wouldn't be but it was just fine), and all the ammenities, like the TV/Microwave/Fridge worked fine. the fridge gave a bit of a sketchy odour but it wasn't too bad. i think it was just because it was old and the 'apartment' was small. heat worked fine. there was hot water. the location was good. we walked/bused it everywhere. it's a 15-20 minute walk to roughly the main hollywood strip area. it's a 40min bus ride to the grove/farmer's market. and it's about an hour or so to venice beach. not too bad considering the mode of transportation and how cheap it was (1.25$ /ride). the room definitely was more motel style than anything high-class. some things showed small signs of wear, but u could tell everything was cleaned and washed when we arrived. the motel itself has more of a hippie/vintage look, therefore don't expect everything to be sparkly and new. also, every morning there were cleaning people ready to come in and tidy up. the other thing is the staff is a bit unorganized when it comes to room check-in and check-out. three times they came in and told us we were either supposed to check in or had rent past due, which was false. it wasn't that big a deal though, and there were never any problems with fixing this. the other thing is it could get kind of loud at night/early morning. i guess if you're a heavier sleeper or early riser (or big partier) it wouldn't be a problem. there's a party room and people were friendly and helpful. overall, i would say that for the budget and location and ammenities present the private room was worth my money ($469/week split between 2 ppl). no major issues. for students and travellers it should definitely be good. i guess it depends on the room/cleanliness u happen to get on the given day u check in, but i'm sure if there are any issues the staff would be quick to correct them. we had room 216 and it was up to par!

Reviews.Title: “You will have to compromise”
Reviews.Author: nztraveller09
Reviews.Content: While the location was pretty good, and the price was very good due to it being the low season, we definitely had to compromise on several things... Firstly there was no hot water when we arrived, and given that it was Xmas day, it wasn't fixed til the next night! The private rooms are very good and cheap for what you get - a large room, cleaned thoroughly everyday, your own bathroom, couch or extra bed. However despite the flatscreen tv on our wall, there was never any signal and no1 would come to our room to try and fix it! The heater only worked for one minute before it shut off for the day, and it was winter!!! Our room was right next to the footpath and road, and they only put clear curtains up so the room was really bright and noisey all night! We had to stay in three separate rooms during our 5night stay, which was a bit of a hassle moving almost every day! The location was pretty good - actually on Hollywood boulevard, and it was possible to walk down to the Kodak Theatre etc. or to the supermarket in the other direction. I would recommend taking ear plugs and an eye mask, and low expectations...then you'll be pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKaycee
Reviews.Content: Having read many really bad review before I came, I was really concerned about the state of the hostel. I will call it a hostel because that is what it is, it is not a hotel. I was suprised that my experience was better than expected. Had a private room with bath, worth the extra. Room was big, clean and reasonably well maintained. Housekeeping did a good job. Cable TV set up was fantastic and was a highlight. Lack of aircon was a the downside as it was high 90 degrees and we were upstairs. There was a fan but that did not do much, so this is a place to stay in the coller part of the year unless you love heat. Also, the noise! I think wherever you stay in the hostel it would be loud, down the back, people noise, up the front, trafffic noise. Nothing that a pair of earplugs won't fix though. Some of the staff were fantastic, helping with tours etc. One front desk assistance was just plain uninterested in helping and that was a shame as she was in the minority. I would say if you are on a budget and don't mind the quirks of a hostel, this place is worthwhile. If you are a expecting a hotel, pay more and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst management ever!”
Reviews.Author: Angrycat
Reviews.Content: I have travelled all countries of the world, stayed in numerous hotels, motels and ymca's. I have seen it all and lived it all. But the behaviour of the management of the Vibe Hotel on Hollywood Blvd. astonished my beyond anything I have ever experienced. As a new citizen of Los Angeles, I booked my German friend for 11 nights in to this hotel 2 weeks prior to her arrival. I went to this in person to make the reservation. I filled out the form, gave my credit card nu,ber as well as the security number on the backside of the card and the receptionist assured me the reservation was final. So I left and picked up my friend from LAX at the day of her arrival and we took the airport shuttle to the Hotel on Hollywood Blvd. as per recommendation of the foresaid receptionist. Immagine our surprise that upon our arrival in the hotel, my reservation semed to have vaporized, the receptionist moved back to Spain and my exhausted friend close to collapse. We sat for hours at the reception desk waiting for the manager to arrive. He finally did and was most unkind; basically I was told that I never made a reservation and they could do nothing to help us. The new receptionist called several hotels in the same area, but being it the high season................ finally the manager suggested we should take his offer for a night at the Fairfax at a lower price sure ($60/night), but no refund for the airport shuttle, no offer for a taxi to take us from Hollywood to Fairfax (I had to call my husband to get off work to drive us there), no compensation for the far more expensive Motel6 that had a room available and in the end telling me I should have made the reservation not in person but online so that there would be a record; he even suggested the form I filled out probably ended up in the garbagecan?????????????? I live around the corner of this hotel and basically I booked it for my friend because it really does look good and it's rates are proper for a Hollywood area. But I can assure you, the manager, Joe, has got no clue whatsoever on public relations or how to make his hotel worthwhile to recommend to a next possible traveler. No matter the location, no matter the friendly new receptionist, the unwilling and rude behaviour of the manager made this experience leave a nasty taste.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place For The Money, and Cool...”
Reviews.Author: Morphita
Reviews.Content: The Vibe Hotel is actually a cool Motel from the '50's and has palm trees and is a very fun place. There is free breakfast and we had a kitchen in our room, also lots of free stuff like internet, wireless, parking and a barbeque with free food. The atmoshere was really cool and the people were fantastic to meet. It is close to the metro station and Hollywood stuff. We played billiards and basketball felt vary safe because the security gaurd is very friendly and cares a lot. The VIBE is Cool!

Reviews.Title: “The Vibe - OK”
Reviews.Author: tezza_7
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Vibe and whilst it is not the nicest hostel around, I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, especially when I had to stay an extra nite unexpectedly (due to inefficient Greyhound) and rocked back up at 12.05am. Many thanks to the really cool security dude Mike !!!!! Great tv room and party room etc and I think young people would really dig this place. If you want quiet then this is not the place but if you want people and a bit of a atmosphere and music then this is for you. Oh ... you may need to bring your own AC with you as well.

Reviews.Title: “not the same”
Reviews.Author: dimi_dimit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Vibe a few times and it was always a pleasure to go back, but I have to admit that the last time I went back it wasn't the same. The Orbit took over the place and it has a different flavor. Uptight and arrogant. There was a gentleman running the place, I believe his name is Vlad, who's no longer there. An employee who once worked at the Orbit said that he was set up by the Orbit management, something they'd been trying to do for a long time. The place isn't being ran professionally and it's more about what the staff wants rather than what the guests want. They don't make you feel comfortable, they don't smile the place sucks. If anyone knows where Vlad is, please say hello from London. The ladies at the embassy miss him. Disappointed guess.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MarcusMMcIntire
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at The Vibe and I will be back. The location is perfect; 60 seconds from the Hollywood Freeway (101), and a three minute walk to the Hollywood/Vine Metro Station. Whether one is driving, walking or riding underground, the location is superb. All of the Hollywood Haunts I wish to see are within walking distance. The Vibe rocks with guests from all corners of the world. It provides excellence in every amenity, convenience, and best of all, security. I especially enjoy the modern appliances and fantastic design in each room. I really hate to leave! Finally, Lara, the New Manager is running a tight ship; staff works non-stop and we are going to barbeque and play basketball in the Courtyard on Saturday at Seven! Yippee!

Reviews.Title: “The Vibe is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: OSUPrincess
Reviews.Content: I loved the Vibe. The atmosphere was amazing, and the staf was even better. Prior to my stay, I had read some negative things about the staff and the area, but I experienced NONE of those things when i stayed there. The staff is undergoing some employee changes and its certainly a great thing! The people there made my stay comfortable and accomodated me when there was a problem. I felt just like family and loved it. The security guard has made the area super safe and I never felt a bit worried. The rooms were cleaned every day and everything was on point. The location was SUPERB and I will definately visit again in the very near future! A+++!!

Reviews.Title: “Vibe is A OK!”
Reviews.Author: able2create*
Reviews.Content: Back in September I went to LA for nearly three months. My first stay was at a Hostel on Orange drive and Hollywood Blvd and moved on after 1 week. Clean but Below average. I found Vibe Hotel on a real estate website and found that for a Hostel it exceed my general expectations of a hostel although there were some moments.... I think I have valid grounds to review this place as I stayed here over 9 weeks. Now where to begin.... Housekeeping is EVERYDAY. Apparently there are lots of rumours of the cleaners stealing etc but this is NOT the case. They do not speak English and trying to tell them to come back and clean your room later or tomorrow is the only trouble you'll probably have with them. First room was the private room, where I stayed for four weeks at a rate of 250 dollars per week. Featuring an en suite shower room and bed with basic cable tv, refrigerator and microwave, mirror and a place to store your luggage. This place was clean and immaculate, spotless even the shower. Keys are given on your arrival and check in was smooth. This place has had a serious facelift and sometimes unfortunately you can hear the work going on. How this place works is that if you want to stay more than 28 days you have to move into the large apartment style room with full kitchenette and dining area. These rooms were the ones that needed improving the most as they were the oldest rooms. Kitchen utensils are provided as are fresh towels but I realised that not everything was pristine as I thought. Utensils have to be washed before use as no one else takes care of this. However beds are made everyday and there is a Barbeque Party on Saturday nights if your bored indoors. (Which I doubt you will be) I tried not to complain about anything while I was there until the day I was bitten by bedbugs. I told staff about the problem and they were great and supportive and moved me to another room. They tackled the problem immediately, and I have slept in four of their rooms and bedbugs really ARE rare. It seemed mine was a one off. I could be wrong as maybe other trippers may have found out otherwise... After being there a while I found some staff members started to act unprofessionally towards me and this made me feel uncomfortable. I didn't really complain much since I did not have the 200 pounds per night for hotels such as the Mondrian to stretch over 9 weeks and just got on with it. Service is basic. As I used to go down to make my regular payments I noticed things were not as professional as I thought as often you can hear staff arguing and fighting with one another in the middle of the night usually after they have had a drink or ten. Also, they really DO blaze the music loud so if you want somewhere peaceful, then this is NOT it. There is internet access which is free but given the number of people staying, to only four computers it's best you find an internet cafe, or better still, bring your laptop. Also in terms of getting around this is NOT the ideal place you want to be if you do NOT drive a car. The bus 217 takes ages to arrive and there is constant traffic in LA. The last thing you want to do is get stuck on a bus with weirdos in 4pm rush hour. And just to get to local shops you have to cross the road that leads to the 101 Freeway, quite dangerous if your a pedestrian! The nearest attractions are Hollywood Blvd but this is at least 20-30 minutes walk down the long long boulevard. The best places to stay, eat, shop, party are on the Sunset strip. Vibe is at least 10 minutes by car to the main parts Sunset Boulevard and at least 20 if ou want to be where the action is which is in the Beverly Hills area of the Sunset strip. Also there is Vine, starting from Hollywood and Vine, this crossroad is also where alot of action takes place. Plus the Arclight is nearby and this is the better cinema to hangout as this is where celebs go, better service, seats and general action, NOT the chinese theatre. An amazing record shop is right next door, only I have forgotten it's name! Better than Tower records but tower records is great to buy anything but music.... Regardless of what people say, if your a trendy budget jet setter like me, Hollywood Boulevard is NOT repeat NOT the place to be, the road is littered with mental and disabled people. Homeless and hungry people openly begging sometimes desperatly for food or money. Most of the time though they do not bother you. Further up, by all the so called attractions, are prostitutes and weirdos dressed up as famous characters from film and animation. Junk food and cheap shops selling vulgar items at ridiculous prices. Awful. Downtown LA is the same. The few things to visit there are the fashion, fabric and flower districts, and the Walt Disney Opera House or to catch the bus to disney land... If you have a car, and you are on a budget then this is definately the place to stay for a few days, especially if you are just crashing or trying to find your first ever apartment in LA. Weather: Was warm and bordering on blazing hot during the day, freezing at night during the winter. (Sept-Jan) Be sure to check out the Christmas parade on Hollywood blvd and at the Grove during late November. I visited Santa Monica, which is a more wealthier district and in my opinion one of the more picturesque places in California. Gorgeous beaches trendy beach people but mainly very wealthy, with strings of amazing restaurants, cars and the infamous third street promenade for shopping. I don't think there is any use talking about Rodeo drive as it is one small road, and in my Opinion, Sloane Street in London and Champs Elisees in Paris smack down Rodeo drive, they are just so much better. If you walk up to Santa Monica Pier, you can eat at some of the Oceanside restaurants there whilst catching the views of the sun setting into the Ocean. Amazing. Then there is Venice beach for all you hippy headonistic people out there. There is this thing called the drummers circle where all these free spirited and like minded musicians congregate to make music with what ever instruments they play, but it's mostly various different types of drums. Hence the drummers circle The other place to visit if you are a fashionista is the Grove and the Farmer's Market which is on Fairfax and Third in LA. Near by on Sundays is the flea market to get your one of a kind bits and pices like the celebs so often do. Also eat inside the grove at the many different world food stands where there is mexican and brazilian as well as sushi and southern food just to name a few. Then there is vintage. VINTAGE. Every vintage store you walk into is the size of a supermarket warehouse. They have one pretty much on every street corner, including a couple of famous ones on Melrose. Melrose is a long blvd and I cannot remember if it is North Melrose that has the slightly more up market boutiques and south have the more mainstream ones. Eitherway, GET YOUR ASSES down there because that is where the most amazing shopping of your life will take place. Go to Madison, Fred Segal, Agent Provocateur and Marc Jacobs on one end and Teenage Millionaire, Urban Outfitters and Ed Hardy on the other, these roads go on for miles and miles! PEOPLE: Very hard to meet people, they are indeed quite superficial and never really look up unless your name is Jennifer Aniston or Mischa Barton,but if you do, they are very warm and friendly and welcoming to the Euros, particularly us Brits. Everyone is very clique-y and you have to remember, if you go to various parts of LA, you will not always get the same reception. Also everyone drives because its a way of saying: 'I'm not poor'. Yes. Only poor people walk. Believe it when you see it. Also it's not as integrated as in the UK where black and white people live together and LA is predominately a latino community. In LA, there are NO GO areas you DO NOT WANT TO pass through find these out and beware. However if you know people there and you are familar with these places then go with someone who is street wise, mind you, all of LA LA land is quite dangerous as with any place in the World so make sure your always with company or in your car. Most LA people lock their car doors because apparently car jacking is still rife. In the right company, you may find your self hanging out with millionaires at the SKYbar at the Mondrian Hotel and checking out celebs at the new club called Hollies in Santa Monica! Also the food, at all the restaurants are amazing because Americans do NOT mess about when it comes to food. You can eat very well from Taco bell to Spago. Just remember only eat at places with grade As or Bs on their windows as this means they have passed and they are clean and safe to eat. You MUST stop by at the Griddle on Sunset, everybody knows it, just ask around for where the nearest cross road is, it's the best hangover breakfast food joint you've ever been to. On Saturdays and Sundays there are massive queues going down the street of people just waiting to eat there! Back to vibe Hotel they ARE really student friendly and full of information and regularly arrange trips to Universal Studios and Disneyland. They also sell calling cards and there is a middlebrow supermarket called Ralphs where you can buy your groceries. There is a tube system but in my opinion it is seriously underdeveloped but it's cheap clean and runs regularly if you cannot be bothered to walk or you want to visit the film studios in Burbank in North Hollywood. Now again, watch out because the tube/train system might not be up everyone's street as it picks up manual labourers and the homeless only as as I mentioned earlier, everyone drives. I could not believe the amount of homeless and poor people in LA and the so called American dream is some what an illusion for some this is quite sad, but mind you I was there working... So if you can accept that, then LA is an AMAZING place to be.... Oh and don't forget to tip 10-15 percent of the bill and not 50 percent like I did as restaurant bills were soooo cheap! Will add photos very soon so stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not for me”
Reviews.Author: LibraryShark
Reviews.Content: I booked this place after looking at their website. (Unfortunately, I didn't know about TripAdvisor at the time.) The website is so misleading. I booked a small room with private bath for 6 nights stay. The desk clerk was nice and showed us to our room. It was tiny and directly overlooked Hollywood Blvd. The window was broken and wouldn't close, so the traffic sound was deafening. The heater was broken, and the bed only had a thin blanket. Granted, this is southern California, so it's not like you need a down comforter, but it did get into the 40s at night! We had to wear clothes and socks to bed. There were, inexplicably, two unmade bunk beds crammed into our room along with our rock-hard queen-sized bed. These bunk beds completely blocked the closet, and there was no other place to store our clothes. Also, the toilet was the tiniest thing I have ever seen, and it got clogged immediately. (There was a plunger and I had to use it within the first 5 minutes of being there.) Also, there was a huge bucket of mop-water and Lysol outside our room, and it never moved the whole time we were there. The odor was disgusting. There is no phone in the room so if you want to contact the staff, you have to keep running down to the office. Also, the place is apparently only cleaned 3 times per week, I overheard the office clerk telling another guest. We had booked 6 nights there, but thank goodness the manager was nice and understood that it wasn't the place for us. We dealt with him politely and he was polite in return. So we only stayed the first night and received a refund for the remaining 5 nights. I think that much younger travelers (and we're only in our late 20s; it's not like we're elderly) who don't have much to spend on lodging might get a kick out of this place. The courtyard was nice and there's free internet access with plenty of Mac computers on site. The Vibe's vibe is very young. It's kind of like the dorms at college. I think that the location is really good, because it's on the outer edge of Hollywood and there is a cheap vegan restaurant directly across the street and a good Thai place 2 doors down. So I don't want to completely disparage it -- it's just totally not the kind of place I want to stay anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Yah Man”
Reviews.Author: darcysays
Reviews.Content: Vibe Hotel - like the name suggests has something of a Vibe to it. We booked a standard room and got lucky and were upgraded to a deluxe, which had 2 more beds than we needed and plenty of space. The manager was a cool dude, always around and was quick to help out with anything. They have free internet - about 4 machines and wireless (this works best round the office, not so well in our room). They had a sort of chill out room where people would gather and listen to reggae beats - along with a BBQ on the weekend. This is cool if you are interested in meeting people and having fun times, but it probably isn't so good for older people or those who love early nights. I think the rooms by the road can tend to be a bit noisy, so if you can get one back off the road do it. Location is good, subway is close (Hollywood and Vine) there is a nice Thai food place next door and a supermarket 10 mins walk away where you can fill up your fridge with sugar & fat™ USA groceries. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Laid Back”
Reviews.Author: Harkgrl
Reviews.Content: My visit to the Vibe was a great experience. They have a free BBQ on Saturday nights which gives you the opportunity to hang out and socialize with other guests. The staff is friendly and very accomodating going out of their way to make sure you have what you need (extra blankets, towels, etc). The private rooms are fantastic and decorated in a very hip and funky way. It is close to transportation and there are plenty of things to do down Hollywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Biggeer
Reviews.Content: They have bedbugs in 105 and it stinks. Plus there is a girl there who is having allergic reactions to the bedbugs and they refuse to move her to anothe room. The manager, Vlad, is shady and pocketed the cash I paid him, I was told by the employees this is common.

Reviews.Title: “This is Not a True Hostel but a Residential Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delzakiya
Reviews.Content: Vibe is good for the money, but the pictures are deceptive and the only rooms that colorful are private and maybe the kitchen The weekly BBQ is so late that most people do not partake or are too drunk by the time the food is ready. In fact, too many were drunk on a nightly basis, and since the main area is outside you could not avoid the area. There is NO airconditioning and dorms are 6 people. It was unbearable. The Vibe used to be a apartment building with little 300 sq ft studios. Somehow the Vibe thought a room designed for 2 at the most would be comfortable for 6. It was not. Further, they looked putting men in with the women when they had no reason to. For the most part many people live in CA and live at the Vibe because they do not have jobs that can support them in their own place. There are some travellers, but they stay very short because of the issues with the staff moving people, touching their things, stealing by staff, etc. Of the time I spent in the Vibe, 75% were living there on a permanent basis. They had mail delivered to them there. Further, the Vibe has been making more rooms into private rooms due the size, so by years end it could be back to its original purpose. The computer lab was constantly busy, old OS, and slow. The area is close to transportation, but the real problem is that it is on the seedie side of Hollywood Blvd where homeless teens sleep outside across the street. This would not be the place to send someone who is getting their first view of America or Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for everyone”
Reviews.Author: aferdy
Reviews.Content: Vibe is FANTASTIC. The location is great. The people are very friendly and groovy :). The rooms are clean and good price value. And one last thing that I wont forget, I stupidly left my luggage there and just realized before take-off. So I called and asked them to keep my luggage until someone came over and took it. And now I've got my luggage back. Thank you guys. I'll sure stay there again on the next trip. Note: Makasih Debbie...:p

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place was a good value for the money. nothing extravagant, but nothing wrong either. i'm not sure why there were so many complaints. we had a private room, which could have used some Air Conditioning, but once night time came it was manageable. this place definitely has a hostel vibe, so if you're looking for peace and quiet, you might want to look elsewhere. if you enjoy the friendly, party, hostel atmosphere, this is a great place to stay. great hollywood location too, close to everything you'll want to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service and a great location at an excellent price, we couldn't be happier with our stay. The rooms were very clean and quite spacious, all with free parking and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vibe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Vibe is a fantastic atmosphere for those looking for an ambitious and firendly staff (emphasize the FRIENDLY!). It is populated by both energetic hipsters and colorful bohemians alike. I felt very welcomed from the get-go and I felt very well taken care of. Visitors should prepare to interact with those of a high level of personality, from check-in to check out. Both the clientele and staff are colorful and interesting, not at all snobby and they always welcome a friendly conversation. Every single one of the staff members always greeted me. Whatever you read about the Vibe, you need to listen to those who have actually stayed here. It is a fun and funky atmosphere that I'm sure twenty-somethings will truly have fun with!!

Reviews.Title: “No Way”
Reviews.Author: sofearless
Reviews.Content: This place is not even a hostel (as it was advertised on the site I booked through)- it's a former (or not-so-former) fleabag/crackhead apartment building. When I drove through the narrow entryway I was immediately greeted by an angry looking gangster guy who stared at me the whole time I sat in my car trying to figure out if this was actually the place I booked since it looked so different from the pictures I had seen. Everyone walking around looked like they had experienced the worst of life and there was no way these people were vacationers. When the girl in the "office" finally got off the phone I asked her if this was actually an apartment building and she said that they were trying to make it into a hostel but were waiting for 13 of the tenants to get out. Nice. Anyway, she looked my reservation up and apparently there was a problem- I'd have my private room for the first night and the next night I'd have to stay in the dorm with her (what?!), but "the rest of the nights will be in the private room!". This was too much, I demanded my deposit back and went to another hotel nearby that a friend had told me about (luckily I had a car). How they can have the gall to charge what they do is beyond me since for that price there are plenty of decent places in the area. The Vibe (the building is not marked, so I guess that's what they call this place) is a downright dump and seemingly unsafe to boot. I ended up staying in a MUCH nicer place around the corner for $10 more.

HotelInfo.Name: Vibe Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 5922 Hollywood Blvd., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
